DataElement.preferredName: Findings About Events or Interventions Domain Bone Marrow Biopsy And/Or Aspirate Involvement Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The result outcome following a biopsy and/or aspirate to assess bone marrow involvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Findings About Events or Interventions Domain Bone Marrow Biopsy And/Or Aspirate Involvement Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to findings about events or interventions._The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Fluid withdrawn from a body cavity, organ, cyst, or tumor._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._The result of an action.

Property.preferredName: Bone Marrow Biopsy And/Or Aspirate Involvement Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Fluid withdrawn from a body cavity, organ, cyst, or tumor.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Fluid withdrawn from a body cavity, organ, cyst, or tumor.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.
